Source analysis: The expert likely examined the source of the claim, which was a hoax site called Daily World Update. They may have investigated the credibility and reputation of this site to determine its reliability in providing accurate information.
Content analysis: The expert would have analyzed the content of the claim itself. They would have assessed the details provided, such as the description of a captured ISIS leader with an unlocked iPhone containing the phone numbers of world leaders. They may have evaluated the plausibility and coherence of these details.
Fact: checking: The expert would have conducted fact-checking to verify the accuracy of the claim. They might have cross-referenced the information with reliable sources, such as official statements or news reports, to determine if there was any evidence supporting the existence of the claimed phone numbers on the ISIS leader's cell phone.
Contextual analysis: The expert would have considered the broader context surrounding the claim. This could involve evaluating the motives and interests of the source, examining any political or social factors that could influence the veracity of the claim, and taking into account any previous instances of misinformation or disinformation related to similar topics.
